title: Computer Store to Look at
body: I'm getting a new pc (finally) but I don't know where to start looking. I don't want to go over the price of $2000. Any help would be great. I want it to run smoothly and be able to put high or very high graphics on it in game. I will mainly only use it for League and some smaller games like csgo or other small steam games.

replies.body:
Build your own. You can build a beast of a machine for around $1300 that the stores would try to sell you for about $3000.

I too had never done it before but luckily have a few friends who have and they helped me. It was surprisingly easy and anyone who isn't a monkey can 100% make their own.

You can look up good "parts lists" on PC forums and stuff. Don't know where you live, but i ordered most my parts from MSY.com. You can buy online or go to a store which is nice.

If you are 100% adamant about buying prebuilt.. http://www.msy.com.au/viconline/content/31-system-packages

Check out the "Gaming PC 3". Pretty good for the price. If you bought the components separately prob cost you about $1000, so they making 500 for just putting it together. Good thing about buying from a PC parts seller is you can talk to them and ask to change parts and stuff for better ones.

Surely you could run LoL at max specs for around half that?
Or are you buying from a shop, rather than components online and assembling it yourself?
Coz if you are, you're paying double.

Don't really know how to build my own PC so :/ and I don't know what parts I would need.

You should go on youtube and search up how to build your own PC, although it might be a little expensive it is worth it as you can optimise your specs and graphics card, etc.

League shouldn't require a lot of spacing from your computer, but hey the better the specs the better the game or maybe it is a bad saying xD
